result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tradon Ledonta Hall

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tradon Ledonta Hall not in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Tradon Ledonta Hall.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Tradon Hall not in court. Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Earl Darnell Holt.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Further, the court vacates 09/12/2022 jury trial date and converts it to a Calendar Call. Case adjourned to Br 16. 
Calendar call scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. States Updated Witness List
State's Notice of Expert Testimony, filed

Defendant Tradon Ledonta Hall in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski, via zoom.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of John Rejowski for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Defense, further requests Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates. Court sets 08/31/2022 deadline for filing trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Final Pre-Trial scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tradon Ledonta Hall in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel requests additional time to review discovery material and offer with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (17 pages) commencing 03/15/2022 by DANIELLE N. HOLCOMB.

Defendant Tradon Ledonta Hall in court with Attorney Ashley Fard who appeared on behalf of Attorney Amanda Poznanski; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ayala.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
01/08/22.    22RM001601

Defendant Tradon Ledonta Hall in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Poznanski is in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tradon Ledonta Hall
Current: 2432 West Auer Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 02-04-2022)
Prior: 2436 West Auer Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant previously posted $5,000 cash bail. Court orders $1,000 remain on deposit and the remaining balance be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Tradon Ledonta Hall in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Jon Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/22 @ 1p
